items.headline: ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live!’ returned to network TV. Other outspoken American workers may not be so fortunate.
items.summary_en: Yes, your employer can fire you for your views on Charlie Kirk and Jimmy Kimmel.

items.headline: I’m 70 and have Alzheimer’s. My son’s girlfriend put $750 worth of lottery tickets on a credit card I gave him. What can I do?
items.summary_en: “I contacted the credit-card company, but was advised they could not reimburse me for the theft.”

items.headline: Sure, there’s a risk of a bubble in AI stocks, so invest in them, says Wells Fargo strategist
items.summary_en: Wells Fargo’s chief equity strategist Ohsung Kwon said the AI trade will continue to dominate stock market gains, until this beaten-down area of the economy starts to show signs of life.

items.headline: Alibaba stock is flying higher, two days after Cathie Wood’s first purchase since 2021
items.summary_en: Tech investor Cathie Wood this week bought Alibaba stock for the first time in four years, and it’s already turning out to be a good investment.

items.headline: What Jimmy Kimmel said in his first show back may not matter. Disney has already been hammered by the culture wars.
items.summary_en: The decision to pull Kimmel off the air sparked calls for a boycott from his supporters, and the move to bring him back has angered conservatives, putting Disney in an unwinnable position.

items.headline: Here’s Palantir’s ‘secret sauce,’ which these analysts say can boost the stock even more

items.headline: Micron’s stock gains as the memory-chip maker clears a high bar

items.headline: Nvidia’s OpenAI deal adds to a brewing concern. But will that actually hurt the stock?

items.headline: Why the rally in stocks may only pause into year-end despite a ‘stretched’ market
items.summary_en: The bull market in U.S. stocks might not see much more than a pause for the rest of this year, despite the S&P 500’s lofty valuation, according to Morgan Stanley’s Andrew Slimmon.
